description: * Image Acquisition by LTA. * Processing: Ruben Barbosa. Astrometry.net job: 2562036 RA: 20h 45' 51" DEC: +30Â° 54' 50" Field radius: 0,098 This area of Veil Nebula is located to the left of the bright star 52 Cyg. About 7,000 years ago, a star with mass greater than twenty solar masses, ceased its nuclear reactions and evolved into the supernova phase. At an estimated distance of 1,500 light-years in the direction of the Swan constellation, we can find the remnant of this star extending by a diameter of ~3 degrees, equivalent to 6 times the size of the Moon. This cloud of gas and heated dust exhibits structures formed by delicate filaments coated with extraordinary beauty and is known as the Veil Nebula. Compare with HST image: The Veil Nebula (HH), close-up.
title: NGC 6960, Western Veil Nebula
